reviews.review: Это хорошая, годная игра. Я познакомился с ней конечно поздновато, но мне понравилась рассказанная история, да и в свободном режиме отдохнуть после работы вполне подходит. Ну и мир... мир воздушного города безумно красив!
自带繁体中文很良心，第一眼看到天空之城感觉很震撼，伊丽莎白也很漂亮；带魔法技能的战斗也还行就是玩久了有点枯燥；情节也很精彩，打折入绝对不亏!
求求各位大佬告诉我为啥一打开就闪退啊！2012C+装了，输入法也是英文的了，也使用管理员身份了，驱动也更新了。还是不行。

EDIT:

Lanet olası gemili bölümü geçtikten sonra, o sikik gemili bölüm hariç oyunun hatrına incelememi güncelliyorum. Evet aslında güzel oyun. Oynanabilecek FPS oyunlarının pek bulunmadığını göz önünde bulundurursak, oyunun başlangıcından ilk yarısına kadar olan atmosferi büyüleyici.

Teknik olarak eksiklerine gelirsek; İlk sırada "vuruş hissi"nin berbat olması gelir. Bunun haricinde öyle ahım şahım bir eksi yanı da yok. Tabii, o sikik gemili bölümü saymazsak.

Sonuç olarak gayet güzel bir oyun, alın oynayın.

---------------------------------------------

Bu oyuna bir kuruş para verip almayın. Dünyanın en boktan oyunu bu. Aferin size, süper iş çıkarmışsınız.. O sikik gemili bölümünüzü de alın ne bok yiyorsanız yiyin.. Sanırsın ultra zor seviyede hardcore fps oynuyoruz mk.. "Easy" seçmişim ve ironik derecede inanılmaz, şaka gibi bir zorluk.. Zorluk falan denemez iğrenç bir oynanış, iğrenç, mantıksız saçma sapan bir kurgu ve inanılmaz iğrenç saçma sapan ve boktan bir zorluk. Üstüne para verseler de oynamayın.

첫째는.. 2편은 그냥 맨 나중에 하는 것을 추천드립니다. 이유는 이야기가 외전격이어서.. 
연결고리가 별로 없기 때문에.. 나중에 해도 무관. 시리즈 순서대로 2편을 중간에 섞어서 해버리면 
오히려 1편과 인피니트 스토리를 연결 하는데 조금 방해받는 감이 있습니다.
안그래도 복잡하고 심오한 스토리인데 집중도를 높이고 싶다면 1편 후 바로 인피니트를 하고 
dlc바다의무덤까지 다 마치는걸 추천드립니다.

둘째는.. 음성일지는 꼭 다 확인하자.. 그래야 조금이라도 더 연결고리들을 확실하게 알 수 있고. 
소름의 크기와 횟수가 커집니다.. 인피니트는 1편과 다르게 음성일지를 인벤토리로 가야 확인이 
가능하기 때문에.. 놓칠 수도 있어서 꼼꼼하게 하는걸 추천드립니다 ㅎㅎ

정말 스토리에 있어서는 최고의 명작이었습니다. 뒤늦게 접했지만 평생 기억에 남을것 같네요..

[h1]O ano é 2013, o mundo está completamente desolado em crise existencial. Es então que a enviada dos deuses, 2K games, desce do paraíso para nos entregar mais uma obra brilhante da saga [u]Bioshock[/u].[/h1]

Seguindo a linha de seus antecessores, Bioshock Infinite tem seu principal destaque em sua trama. Uma história complexa, desenvolvida em torno de uma civilização futurista, repleta de reviravoltas épicas, personagens bem construídos e suas relações exploradas do início ao fim. Mesmo sendo um jogo num contexto bem diferente dos 2 primeiros, é fantástico a forma como o rumo das coisas apresentam claramente uma ligação entre toda a saga.

O jogo apresenta um storytelling muito bem contado e interpretativo, sendo possível se perder na história ao não prestar atenção nos mínimos detalhes. Apesar disso, nada é entregue de mão beijada e de forma racional "jogue e saiba a história toda". Para compreender bioshock como um todo, é necessário se aprofundar em cada momento e ir ligando o quebra-cabeça. Principalmente no que diz respeito a ligação do Infinite com os outros 2 jogos.

Irei dispensar comentários do gameplay, por se tratar de algo esperado em jogos do gênero.

Os aspectos visuais e sonoros do game formam um casal perfeito para criar uma atmosfera imersiva e surreal. Seguindo uma linha retro, com uma forte influência steampunk. Infinite retoma objetos, trajes, estilo musical, todos derivados do sec XX. Muitos aspectos visuais e sonoros podem ser considerados uma obra de arte e longe de estarem ultrapassados por uns bons anos. Ressaltando que todo esse conjunto trabalha em completa harmonia com o clima, ambientação e roteiro desenvolvido pelo game.

Há muito o que se dizer, mas Infinite é um jogo indispensável para a saga bioshock. Sendo um prato cheio para os amantes de histórias, não necessariamente jogos. Independente de ser um shooter.

[h1]O jogo constantemente se encontra em promoção durante as sales. Valendo 100% a compra da saga completa ou do Infinite + Season Pass ([b]Sim, COMPRE O PASSE, AS DLC'S SÃO DE EXTREMA IMPORTÂNCIA[/b]).[/h1]
Uma historia digna de um best seller combinada com uma gameplay fluida

I played this game way after it was released and after knowing "some" of the plot points. I did not finish Bioshock 1 and did not play Bioshock 2 at all.

Even with those in mind I absolutely loved this game from start to finish, even if it did make me a bit of an emotional wreck by the end of Burial at Sea Episode 2. The characters are great, the story is great, the voice acting is great, the combat is fun, and the overall presentation is just superb. There are plenty of callbacks and hints to the previous Bioshock games, but Infinite plays out in a way that I did not feel out of the loop at any point. Highly recommended.

Great game
This game should be what other developers study to learn how to make a good game.

-Gameplay:
The gameplay in Bioshock Infinite is extremely simple and repetitive. You enter a room or area, kill the enemies inside, and move on. Really the only diversity in the gameplay is the vigors (powers that you can use to help you in combat). The problem with the vigors however is that by the time you unlock them all, you'll already be maybe an hour from completing the game, so whats the point? There are only a few guns in the game, and just like the vigors, you will start to get them way too late in the game to actually use them. For example, i finally found a burst gun when i had maybe 2 hours of gameplay left, and i couldnt even use it because i didnt have enough time to upgrade it to the point of being useful. For an fps however, i think the combat is alright i guess.
-Environment:
The world of Bioshock Infinite is a beautiful, floating version of an early 20th century city in America. There are some cool views, lots of stores and other buildings to go into, and the colors certainly make it stand out from the environment in other games. However, there is an extreme lack of character to it per se. There isnt really anything to make the player WANT to explore the environment. Its pretty weak.
-Story: 
The story is pretty predictable, i was able to predict the ending when i was halfway through the game, and it sort of has a hard time getting the player to be deeply invested. The first half of the game goes by extremely slowly, and mainly consists of going from place to place, being confused for the sake of being confused, and trying to figure out what the heck is with the creepy twins that teleport from place to place. Near the second half of the game however, it is almost too much information, as if the devs were trying to rush it along just to get it over with. Its a pretty cliche story, and relies a bit too much on shock value.
-Overall:
Overall i think the game is fun for a while, but it is definetely not memorable. The best thing about it is the soundtrack and the characters, who are excellently voiced by the way. I wouldnt recommend it for the price that its still going at, especially when you can finish it in under 10 hours. Overrated, and a missed opportunity.

Pros: 
- The story starts off slow, then gains momentum and becomes mind-bogglingly creative close to the end.
- The fights are often surprising and hard, but always fair with the right combination of abilities (I admit that I haven't always figured out the best strategy. I died a lot.)
- Level design is quite good for the most part.

Cons:
- Some fights are too long, and at some point, they become repetitive. As a shooter, the game is okay but not the best of its class, but combined with the story, the game really shines.

Notes:
- I haven't played through the DLC yet.
